member.summary: Generic command which calls delegate function(s) to execute or get the status.

member.summary: Creates an instance which calls the specified and delegates when executed.

member.summary: Fired when the execution status has changed.

member.summary: Checks whether this command is currently available for execution.

member.summary: Fires the event, causing consumers of this command to update their status.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey
member.summary: Complete set of keyboard virtual key definitions, an expanded version of the XAML "Windows.System.VirtualKey" like the Windows Forms "Keys" enumeration, which is not currently available in WinRT.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Alt
member.remarks: Originally named "MENU" in header file but "Alt" name taken for more intuitive use.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.CapsLock
member.remarks: Originally named "CAPITAL" in header file but "CapsLock" name taken for more intuitive use.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.ImeHanguel
member.summary: IME Hanguel mode (maintained for compatibility; use ).

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.PageUp
member.remarks: Originally named "PRIOR" in header file but "PageUp" name taken for more intuitive use.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.PageDown
member.remarks: Originally named "NEXT" in header file but "PageDown" name taken for more intuitive use.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem1
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the ';:' key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem2
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the '/?' key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem3
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the '`~' key

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem4
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the '[{' key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem5
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the '\|' key

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem6
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the ']}' key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem7
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard. For the US standard keyboard, the 'single-quote/double-quote' key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem8
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Oem102
member.summary: Either the angle bracket key or the backslash key on the RT 102-key keyboard.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.Packet
member.summary: Used to pass Unicode characters as if they were keystrokes. The VK_PACKET key is the low word of a 32-bit Virtual Key value used for non-keyboard input methods. For more information, see Remark in KEYBDINPUT, SendInput, WM_KEYDOWN, and WM_KEYUP.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.CursorSelect
member.summary: CrSel key. Defined by IBM as cursor select.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.ExtendedKeySelect
member.summary: ExSel key. Defined by IBM as extended key function select (pressed before the key with an extended function).

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.PA1
member.summary: PA1 key. Defined by IBM as the "WINDOW POP WM" key.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardKey.PA2Clear
member.summary: OEM Clear. Defined by IBM as the "PA2 CLEAR WM" key.

member.summary: Translates a virtual key to an input character when relevant.

member.summary: Translates a virtual key to an input character when relevant.
member.param: True to return uppercase characters, e.g. when shift is also pressed.
member.returns: String (normally one character) or null when no mapping, e.g. function key.

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardShortcuts
member.summary: Keyboard shortcut data, disconnected from any API dependencies, useful for future proof serialization and cross-platform. A copy of System.Windows.Forms.Shortcut. Specifies shortcut keys that can be used by menu items.

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Input.KeyboardShortcuts.None
member.summary: No shortcut key is associated with the menu item.

member.summary: Base class for all page UI models

member.name: T:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel
member.summary: Base class for all UI models

member.name: F:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel.UpdateTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time (in milliseconds) allowed for the UI to process updates before continuing with other updates.
member.remarks: When too short and events are generated too quickly, the UI has no chance to refresh. When too long and processor intensive operations are triggered, the UI could appear to hang. Deadlocks could occur when background threads with call to update the UI thread and another UI action has been performed which also requires the same lock.

member.name: E:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Fired when the model data has changed and the view should be refreshed.

member.name: P:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel.UITaskFactory
member.summary: Task factory for the UI thread.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Frees resources owned by this instance.
member.param: True when called via , false when called during finalization.

member.name: M:CodeForDotNet.UI.Models.UIModel.DoPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.param: Name of the property which changed.
